meanings.definition: Troland (noun): a unit of luminance equal to one candle per square meter
meanings.sent1: The room was well-lit with 10 trolands of brightness.
meanings.sent2: The scientist measured the troland of the screen to ensure optimal viewing conditions.
meanings.sent3: I tried to read in the dark, but I needed more trolands to see the words clearly.
meanings.sent4: Her smile lit up the room like a thousand trolands shining brightly.
meanings.sent5: The troland of the sun at noon made everything look sharp and clear.

meanings.definition: Troland (verb): to measure the luminance of a surface in trolands
meanings.sent1: He carefully trolanded the display to adjust the brightness level.
meanings.sent2: The technician will troland the monitor to ensure it meets the required standards.
meanings.sent3: I trolanded the room before the movie night to set the perfect ambiance.
meanings.sent4: She trolanded the painting with precision, making sure every detail was visible.
meanings.sent5: The photographer trolands each shot to capture the perfect lighting for the scene.
